greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least number k > 0 such that ((2n-1)^k + 1)/(2n) is prime, or 0 if no such prime exists.
link: H. Dubner and T. Granlund, Primes of the Form (b^n+1)/(b+1), J. Integer Sequences, 3 (2000), #P00.2.7.
mathematica: A126659[n_] := Module[{k = 1}, If[n == 14, Return[0]]; While[! PrimeQ[((2 n - 1)^k + 1)/(2 n)], k++]; k]; Table[A126659[n], {n, 2, 48}] (* _Robert Price_, Oct 29 2018 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {if (n==14, return(0)); my(k=3); while (! isprime(((2*n-1)^k + 1)/(2*n)), k = nextprime(k+1)); k;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 23 2018
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Feb 09 2007, Feb 10 2007
